availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James A. Lee, Jr. (Maysville, Kentucky, lawyer and soldier.)

body.p: Maysville, Kentucky, lawyer and soldier. Mason County, Kentucky native. Son of James A. Lee, Sr. and Elizabeth W. Lee. Attended school in Maysville in 1850. Law student in Maysville, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the 16th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as captain from January 5, 1862 to June 27, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 118A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 72.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, Ward 2, p. 14.
Find A Grave, "Capt James A. Lee (1838-1870)," Memorial #114178870, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/114178870# (accessed December 16, 2018).
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 293.
